title: Artificial Intellegence
content:
[img]http://www.blegdandsmeeg.com/AI/0808070959.jpg[/img]
[img]http://www.blegdandsmeeg.com/AI/0808070959a.jpg[/img]
[img]http://www.blegdandsmeeg.com/AI/0808071000.jpg[/img]

I made a well... an electronic brain that started going to the beat of my alarm clock this morning.

Last night I made it start when I sang the catchiest song in the world to it. (Monkey Island theme.)

Today I'm going to see if I can make it understand Star Goose. Then ZZT.

After that I want to see if I can get it to play Commander Keen... Only problem is I don't know how to record it... ah well... one problem at a time I guess. Hee hee!

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] -----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Artificial Intellegence
content:
Haha. You're a mad... maker of alternatives to stuff. Is that a better term than [url=http://comments.deviantart.com/5/14029407/509592608]scientist[/url]?

What exactly does "going to the beat of my alarm clock" mean?

Let me know when it understands Keen, so I can use it to beat Episode Smile.

title: Re: Artificial Intellegence
content:
"Let me know when it understands Keen, so I can use it to beat Episode Smile."
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] Good one Spleen. Yeah, better make it highly intelligent while you're at it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Heh, seems like something Billy would do. Interesting... How does it work, technically? Anyways, good luck trying to get it "understand" complex stuff like playing a platformer, not sure if that's possible.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Artificial Intellegence
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Haha. You're a mad... maker of alternatives to stuff. Is that a better term than scientist?[hr][/quote]
I think the term "mad scientist" would fit here... Hehehe...

Anyway, this stuff is WAY COOL! ALPHANUMERIC! Etc. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Geez man, you made an AI robot?!____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Artificial Intellegence
content:
I'll just straight up say what I did. I used my own... genetic data and, through electrolosis, made a fluid that interrupted the electrical flow of a series of flashing lights.

I meant it was "going to my alarm clock" because when I woke up and looked out from under my covers the light was alternating flashing every second, on the buzzer.

Unfortunately I was not able to do anything more with that... so I moved on and artificially inseminated a chicken egg with modified genetic data. Unfortunately I don't know what... to do with the egg now. I was going to eat it. (It is still raw on the inside.)

And last night I did something that had to do with cold fusion... Unfortunately when I woke up I forgot it. (ARGH!) Sooo... I just dumped out all the stuff I have been working on. If I ever feel like continuing all I need is some of my blood, blood plasma, earwax, or other... bodily fluids.

So yeah. I made an artificial intellegence and threw it away the next day.

I'm still going to eat that chicken egg though.-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Artificial Intellegence
content:
